title: Appeals Court Blocks Trump’s Use of Alien Enemies Act to Deport Venezuelans
summary: The ruling was a setback for the Trump administration on the mass deportation of immigrants, one of its domestic policy goals.

title: L.A. Ruling Complicates Trump’s Threats to Send Troops to More Cities
summary: As Democratic cities brace for possible military deployments, Democratic governors see in a lower-court ruling the potential for legal protections.

title: Google Must Share Search Data With Rivals, Judge Rules in Antitrust Case
summary: Judge Amit P. Mehta said the company must hand over some of its search data to rivals, but did not force other big changes the U.S. wanted.

title: What Will Happen to Google After the Antitrust Ruling?
summary: The judge’s decision positions Google to keep its search business running largely without interruption.

title: What the Fixes for Google’s Search Monopoly Mean for You: It’s a ‘Nothingburger’
summary: A federal judge’s remedy stops short of making meaningful changes to how we use our phones, computers and the web.

title: Trump Responds to Rumors About His Health During Oval Office Press Conference
summary: In the world of presidential health, distrust and speculation run so rampant that even Mr. Trump’s online assurance that he was fine was immediately explained away as part of a cover-up.

title: Cook’s Lawyers Fire Back at Trump’s Claim of Vast Powers to Oust Fed Officials
summary: Lisa Cook is seeking a swift ruling on her ability to remain on the Federal Reserve’s Board of Governors as the case is litigated.

title: Xi Parades Firepower to Signal That China Won’t Be Bullied Again
summary: The parade, attended by the leaders of Russia and North Korea, had a defiant message. President Trump fired back, accusing Xi Jinping of ignoring America’s role in World War II.

title: Kim Jong-un Brings a His Daughter and Potential Heir, Ju-ae, to Beijing
summary: Kim Ju-ae’s presence at a major gathering of world leaders is the latest sign that North Korea’s dictator considers her a successor, analysts said.

title: China’s Military Spectacle
summary: China used a parade of fighter jets, missiles and goose-stepping troops to honor the country’s wartime sacrifice and issue a defiant warning to rivals.

title: A Hidden Camera Protest Turned the Tables on China’s Surveillance State
summary: Before fleeing China, an activist in Chongqing staged an elaborate one-man demonstration against the Communist Party that doubled as performance art.

title: After Name Mix-Up, Online Rage Is Directed at Wrong C.E.O. in U.S. Open Hat Scandal
summary: The chief executive of the Polish company Drogbruk was captured on video snatching a hat in front of a child. The head of Drog-Bruk, a different firm, is getting attacked. The executives also have similar surnames.

title: House Oversight Panel Releases Some Epstein Files as Pressure Mounts
summary: The move came as Republican leaders pressed colleagues not to force a vote on disclosing all the material. Most of what was released on Tuesday was not new.

title: Trump Says U.S. Attacked Boat Carrying Venezuelan Gang Members, Killing 11
summary: The vessel was transporting illegal narcotics through international waters to the United States, the president said.

title: Maduro Says War With Venezuela Would Stain Trump’s Hands with Blood
summary: As U.S. warships and troops gather in the Caribbean, Mr. Maduro threatened an “armed fight” in response to any military action. He also appealed for peace.

title: Netanyahu Faces High-Level Opposition to His Stance on Gaza Truce
summary: High-level political and security figures are said to be resisting the prime minister’s demand for a comprehensive deal to end the war in Gaza.

title: A Kennedy, a Protégé and a Progressive Star Eye Nadler’s N.Y. House Seat
summary: Representative Jerrold Nadler’s departure is still 16 months away, but Democrats are already testing the waters in what is expected to be a highly contested race.

title: Animal Activists Target Farmers in Sonoma, Known as ‘America’s Provence’
summary: A new generation of activists has used extreme tactics and viral video to challenge farmers in Sonoma County, a region known for some of the industry’s most humane practices.

title: Nemat Shafik, Columbia President During Protests, Takes Another Tough Job
summary: Dr. Shafik, who came under fire for her handling of pro-Palestinian campus protests last year, is now the chief economic adviser to Britain’s prime minister.

title: Is ‘The Wizard of Oz’ at Sphere the Future of Cinema? Or the End of It?
summary: Our critic went to Las Vegas to see the immersive presentation of the classic 1939 film. What she saw defied easy categorization.

title: Heidi Gardner and More ‘SNL’ Cast Members Exit Show Ahead of Season 51
summary: The upcoming season of “Saturday Night Live” will feature five new faces. Departing are Heidi Gardner, Michael Longfellow, Emil Wakim and Devon Walker.

title: Mass Migration and Liberalism’s Fall
summary: A decade on, Angela Merkel’s immigration disaster has created a right-wing surge.

title: The Door to Another African Democracy Is Closing
summary: The conviction of the transitional prime minister in Chad is emblematic of how democracy is eroding across the Sahel region of Northern Africa.

title: Cardi B Is Found Not Liable for Assault in Civil Trial
summary: The rapper and pop star had been accused in a lawsuit of scratching and spitting on a security guard in 2018.

title: Under New Law, Greece Can Imprison Rejected Asylum Seekers
summary: A surge in migrants landing on Crete this summer has diminished, but Greece is hoping to deter future undocumented immigration.

title: Mark Knoller, 73, White House Reporter and Font of Presidential Facts, Dies
summary: As a longtime correspondent for CBS News Radio, he kept meticulous records of presidential activities, from vacation days to teleprompter use.

title: Alberta Backs Off on School Library Book Ban
summary: Alberta ordered schools to pull “inappropriate” books, but paused its plan after a large school district banned scores of books in an apparent effort to make a point.
